comments.author: FurgoPlay's

comments.text:
1) VICE is known at times to make something ether way bigger than it really 
is and make things smaller then they really are. PMCs in Afghanistan are at 
most 20,000 but now thesedays the Afghanistan military is the largest now 
at 352,000 now these days from what I can find but some sources vary show 
we have 18-20,000 35,000 or 60,000 as far as we know from 2014-15. But any 
data that I'm finding base on what they were showing 62% doesn't seem to be 
able to found for a few hours couldn't find a damn thing not sure if I have 
bad luck or is this data a lie. Sure in the 21 century right now we are at 
a all time high after 9/11 but in reality PMC are still a minority in 
warfare. 

2) Now it may seem uncomfortable when the idea of a PMC business turns on 
you but that would be very bad for their business if no one who has money 
can pay that company off. If You pay a group of guys that fought with you 
now and now turns on you there's a risk that the person isn't giving you a 
enough money for your guys and company as a whole that could run you out of 
business, along with the respect for that nation and military you turn on 
may have a hard long time taking you back. Plus no PMC group can take on a 
world power or a very strong nation both in terms of quality and quantity 
at most it would have to be with the weaker boys on the street and that 
alone too won't be easy let alone the response it will get globally.

3) Although it is true that PMCs aren't very regulated in some ares but in 
other areas they are and some are base on morals and common sense not like 
that good enough but however it has work. Even PMCs themselves support the 
idea of rules for companies like this to follow.

4) I found the first 30 seconds to be a rather fuck you to soldiers, 
leaders and nations everywhere as painting it as we fight wars because of 
just money while in reality wars are fought over many other things much 
more needed. Soldiers are ether drafted or freely join on their own will 
knowing what could happen to them.
  ﻿
